controls.title: buffer/gets
controls.desc: Does not check for buffer overflows (CWE-120, CWE-20).

controls.title: buffer/strncat
controls.desc: Easily used incorrectly (e.g., incorrectly computing the correct maximum size to add) [MS-banned] (CWE-120).

controls.title: buffer/_tcsncat
controls.desc: Easily used incorrectly (e.g., incorrectly computing the correct maximum size to add) [MS-banned] (CWE-120).

controls.title: buffer/MultiByteToWideChar
controls.desc: Requires maximum length in CHARACTERS, not bytes (CWE-120).

controls.title: misc/SetSecurityDescriptorDacl
controls.desc: Never create NULL ACLs; an attacker can set it to Everyone (Deny All Access), which would even forbid administrator access (CWE-732).

controls.title: buffer/strcpy
controls.desc: Does not check for buffer overflows when copying to destination [MS-banned] (CWE-120).

controls.title: buffer/sprintf
controls.desc: Does not check for buffer overflows (CWE-120).

controls.title: format/printf
controls.desc: If format strings can be influenced by an attacker, they can be exploited (CWE-134).

controls.title: buffer/scanf
controls.desc: The scanf() family's %s operation, without a limit specification, permits buffer overflows (CWE-120, CWE-20).

controls.title: format/syslog
controls.desc: If syslog's format strings can be influenced by an attacker, they can be exploited (CWE-134).

controls.title: buffer/_mbscpy
controls.desc: Does not check for buffer overflows when copying to destination [MS-banned] (CWE-120).

controls.title: buffer/lstrcat
controls.desc: Does not check for buffer overflows when concatenating to destination [MS-banned] (CWE-120).

controls.title: shell/CreateProcess
controls.desc: This causes a new process to execute and is difficult to use safely (CWE-78).

controls.title: buffer/getopt_long
controls.desc: Some older implementations do not protect against internal buffer overflows (CWE-120, CWE-20).

controls.title: misc/LoadLibraryEx
controls.desc: Ensure that the full path to the library is specified, or current directory may be used (CWE-829, CWE-20).

controls.title: buffer/char
controls.desc: Statically-sized arrays can be improperly restricted, leading to potential overflows or other issues (CWE-119!/CWE-120).

controls.title: buffer/memcpy
controls.desc: Does not check for buffer overflows when copying to destination (CWE-120).

controls.title: misc/fopen
controls.desc: Check when opening files - can an attacker redirect it (via symlinks), force the opening of special file type (e.g., device files), move things around to create a race condition, control its ancestors, or change its contents? (CWE-362).

controls.title: buffer/strncpy
controls.desc: Easily used incorrectly; doesn't always \0-terminate or check for invalid pointers [MS-banned] (CWE-120).

controls.title: buffer/_tcsncpy
controls.desc: Easily used incorrectly; doesn't always \0-terminate or check for invalid pointers [MS-banned] (CWE-120).

controls.title: buffer/strlen
controls.desc: Does not handle strings that are not \0-terminated; if given one it may perform an over-read (it could cause a crash if unprotected) (CWE-126).
